III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff Qualifications
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pushed youth on to her bed.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed by MDHHS worker on 4/5/23. DCWL
planned to attend the interview via video call. However, MDHHS
worker reported Youth A was very standoffish and did not want to
be interviewed. After refusing repeatedly, Youth A agreed to
answer a few questions. MDHHS worker felt that stopping to call
DCWL would cause Youth A to leave the interview. On 4/7/23
MDHHS worker contacted DCWL and reported interview findings
as follows: Youth A reported two youth were present during the
alleged incident, Youth B and Youth C. Youth A was upset that
MDHHS was contacted and felt an investigation was unnecessary.
Youth A reported that on 4/4/23 Staff 1 went to Youth A’s bedroom
door and knocked on it because she smelled marijuana. Youth A
admitted smoking in her room even though she knew it was not
allowed. A while later, Supervisor and Staff 1 returned to Youth
A’s room to discuss the marijuana smell and search the room.
Youth A admitted she had attitude and told Supervisor and Staff 1
they could not search her room. Youth A admitted that she “got
loud” stating that Staff 1 was also being loud. Youth A stated that
Staff 1 pushed her with two hands, onto her bed. Youth A stated
she did not have any marks and “it was not a big deal.” Youth A
stated that she has diabetes and wears an insulin pump. Youth A
alleged that when Staff 1 pushed her, the insulin pump came off.
Youth A said it is not an issue as she typically installs and
removes the pump herself. Youth A denied having any additional
questions or concerns.
DCWL visited the facility on 4/17/23 to interview Youth A.
However, she was not present. A request was made for Youth A
to contact DCWL, but she has not made contact as of this report
writing.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/17/23 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported being present
during the alleged incident. Youth B stated she walked into the
2

building and smelled marijuana. Youth B heard Youth A yelling at
staff. From what she heard, it sounded like Youth A was upset
that Staff 1 and Supervisor were going to search her room. Youth
B recalled hearing Youth A yell that Staff 1 hit her, but that did not
happen. Youth B stated she was standing right there and Staff 1
did not do anything to Youth A. Youth B also reported that Staff 1
did not cause Youth A’s insulin pump to fall off. Youth B saw
Youth A take the pump off and throw it on the floor.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at school on 4/17/23 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C reported being
present for the alleged incident. Youth C recalled smelling
marijuana in the building. Staff 1 was going room to room to find
who was smoking. When Supervisor came into the building, she
and Staff 1 decided to search Youth A’s room. Youth A
immediately began yelling at Staff 1. Supervisor attempted to get
Youth A to calm down, but Youth A was acting physical, as if she
wanted to fight. Youth C stated that Staff 1 backed away from
Youth A and never pushed her. Youth C reported that Staff 1 did
not cause Youth A’s insulin pump to fall off. Youth C ripped her
insulin pump off, then yelled that Staff 1 did it.
Supervisor/Complainant was interviewed in person on 4/17/23 and
by phone on 4/18/23. Supervisor reported that she was informed
Youth A was smoking marijuana in her room. Supervisor and Staff
1 went to Youth A’s room and knocked on her door. Youth A was
instantly aggressive and upset. Staff 1 was standing near the
bedroom door talking to Youth A. Youth A walked up to Staff 1,
yelling. Youth A then said that Staff 1 pushed her. Youth A was
not pushed. Supervisor said she did not see Staff 1 push Youth A
or put her hands on her at all. Youth A then pulled her insulin
pump off. Staff 1 walked away while Supervisor tried to talk with
Youth A. Supervisor asked Youth A to put her insulin pump back
on, which she did. Supervisor reported that she has never had
prior concerns about Staff 1’s performance and has never seen
Staff 1 put her hands on any youth. Supervisor reported there are
video cameras in the building. However, there was a glitch with
their system and footage from that day was not available.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 4/18/23. Staff 1 reported that
she smelled marijuana in the building and began going room to
room. The smell was very strong and coming from Youth A’s
bedroom. Staff 1 approached Youth A’s room as she was coming
out the door. Staff 1 said “I know you’re not smoking in your
room”. Youth A stated she was not. Staff 1 walked with Youth A
and talked with her for a while. Youth A repeatedly denied
3

smoking in her room. Staff 1 stated it was a friendly conversation
as she and Youth A have a good relationship. A while later,
Supervisor arrived at the facility. Supervisor stated that it smelled
like marijuana in the building. Staff 1 informed Supervisor that she
believed the smell was due to Youth A smoking in her room.
Supervisor indicated that a room search needed to be done to
confiscate any marijuana from Youth A’s room. Staff 1 and
Supervisor knocked on Youth A’s door. Youth A answered very
aggressively, “what do you want?” Youth A was informed a room
search needed to be completed. Youth A became irate, yelling,
and swearing at staff. Youth A refused to let staff enter her room.
Staff 1 was standing in the doorway, Youth A kept turning the
lights off and yelling at staff. Youth A then ran up to Staff 1,
bumping her. Staff 1 put her arm out to protect herself but did not
push Youth A. Youth A then ran into the hallway yelling that Staff
1 pushed her. Youth A pulled her insulin pump off and continued
yelling. Staff 1 walked away from the situation as Supervisor
attempted to talk with Youth A and calm her down. Staff 1 stated
she has never put hands on the youth and never would. She
understood that Youth A was going through a difficult time and did
not take the allegation personally, nor would she treat Youth A any
different because of it. Staff 1 stated she was aware there was a
video camera outside of Youth A’s bedroom and believed the
interaction would be on camera to show that she did not touch
Youth A.
A Conference call occurred with MDHHS worker on 5/1/23.
MDHHS worker reported no findings.
Analysis There was no information found to support the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
